description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As a Logistics Strategy Analyst, you will build complex business models to drive key business decisions and analyze and identify significant improvements opportunities in the existing fulfillment network. You will bring experience in modeling and statistical techniques and the ability to develop sound business proposals even with limited information and changing constraints. In this role, you will use excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and effective communication to work as part of a fast-moving team.

Users come first at Google. Nowhere is this more important than on our Advertising & Commerce team: we believe that ads and commercial information can be highly useful to our users if, and only if, that information is relevant to what our users wish to find or do. Advertisers worldwide use Google Ads to promote their products; publishers use AdSense to serve relevant ads on their website; and business around the world use our products (like Google Shopping, and Google Wallet) to support their online businesses and bring users into their offline stores. We build and maintain the platforms that have made Google what it is today, and are constantly innovating to deliver the most effective advertising and commerce opportunities of tomorrow.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, other relevant fields, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience in advanced business analytics and operations modeling, logistics, and/or retail industries.
  • 5 years of experience working with SQL, and advanced database querying and analysis.
  • Experience with a statistical software, simulation tools, and mixed-integer linear programming solvers.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or PhD in a relevant field.
  • Ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management.
  • Excellent project management, program management, and communication skills.
  • Excellent project leadership skills demonstrating self-direction.
responsibilities:
• Design, build, and maintain business models to identify e-commerce fulfillment network opportunities to support strategic and operational decision making.
  • Work with Product Management and Engineering in the development of business requirements, model design, UI design, testing, debugging, and launch of internal tools for network optimization and scenario analysis.
  • Analyze and forecast the impact of business changes (e.g., impacts to customer service-level-agreements, delivery cost, and area coverage).
  • Propose carrier and fulfillment node volume and geo allocation based on cost, quality, operational complexity, reach, and service level agreement (SLA).
  • Support deep business analytics for the broader Google Express cross-functional teams.
title: Logistics Strategy Analyst
